info.name: OptyShop API
info.description:
Complete API collection for OptyShop - Smart Optical E-Commerce & Simulation System

## Authentication Strategy

### Website (Public) - No Auth Required
- **Auth**: Register (customer/admin with ALLOW_ADMIN_REGISTRATION), Login (customer/admin), Refresh Token
- **Products & Categories**: All GET endpoints
- **Simulations**: All calculation endpoints (PD, lens thickness, recommendations, etc.)
- **Marketing Content**: Case studies, blog, jobs (GET only)
- **Forms**: Configs and submissions (GET configs, POST submissions)
- **CMS**: Banners (/api/banners), Campaigns (/api/campaigns), Brands (/api/brands), FAQs (/api/faqs), Pages (/api/pages/:slug), Testimonials (/api/cms/testimonials)
- **Coupons**: Apply coupon (/api/coupons/apply)
- **Health**: /health, /api

### Customer (Authenticated) - `Authorization: Bearer {{access_token}}`
- **Auth**: Get Current User, Update Profile, Change Password, Logout
- **Cart**: All endpoints
- **Orders**: Create, List, Get by ID, Cancel (customer actions)
- **Prescriptions**: All CRUD operations (customer's own prescriptions)

### Admin (Authenticated) - `Authorization: Bearer {{admin_token}}`
- **Auth**: Get Current User, Update Profile, Change Password, Logout (same endpoints as customer, uses admin_token)
- **User Management**: Create User (customer/admin), Get All Users, Update User
- **Admin Dashboard**: All /api/admin/* endpoints (dashboard, products, categories, frame-sizes, lens-types, lens-coatings, orders, coupons, campaigns, brands, banners, blog-posts, faqs, pages)
- **Orders**: Update status, refund, assign technician
- **Prescriptions**: Validate, verify
- **Simulations**: Config, VTO assets, VTO configs
- **CMS**: Testimonials CRUD (/api/cms/testimonials)
- **Analytics**: All /api/analytics/* endpoints
- **Overview**: /api/overview

## User Registration
- **Customer Registration**: POST /api/auth/register with role="customer" (default)
- **Admin Registration (Testing)**: POST /api/auth/register with role="admin" - Only works if ALLOW_ADMIN_REGISTRATION=true in .env
- **Admin User Creation (Production)**: POST /api/admin/users - Recommended way to create admin users

request.description: Register a new customer account. Role defaults to 'customer' if not provided. Admin role registration requires ALLOW_ADMIN_REGISTRATION=true in environment.

⚠️ WARNING: Admin registration only works if ALLOW_ADMIN_REGISTRATION=true in .env file. For production, use POST /api/admin/users instead. This endpoint will return 403 error if admin registration is disabled.
Login for any user (customer or admin). Returns access_token and refreshToken.
Login for admin users. Use the returned token as {{admin_token}} for admin endpoints.

Get all active products with pagination and filters.

**Response includes for each product:**
- `images`: Array of main product image URLs
- `image`: First image URL of selected color (or main images if no colors)
- `model_3d_url`: URL to 3D model file (null if not available)
- `color_images`: Raw array of color-specific images from database
- `colors`: **Formatted array for color swatches** - Each object contains:
  - `name`: Variant name (e.g., "Black Classic", "Gold Premium")
  - `display_name`: Display name shown to customers (e.g., "Black Classic Premium")
  - `price`: Variant-specific price (null if using base product price)
  - `value`: Color value (lowercase, for matching)
  - `images`: Array of images for this color
  - `primaryImage`: First image URL for this color
  - `hexCode`: Hex color code for swatch display
- `selectedColor`: Default selected color value (first color or null)
- `currentVariantPrice`: Current variant price (or base product price if variant has no price)
- Standard product fields (name, price, description, category, etc.)

**Query Parameters:**
- `page`: Page number (default: 1)
- `limit`: Items per page (default: 12)
- `category`: Filter by category slug
- `subCategory`: Filter by subcategory slug
- `frameShape`: Filter by frame shape
- `frameMaterial`: Filter by frame material
- `lensType`: Filter by lens type
- `gender`: Filter by gender
- `minPrice`, `maxPrice`: Price range filter
- `search`: Search in name, description, SKU
- `sortBy`: Sort field (default: created_at)
- `sortOrder`: Sort direction (asc/desc, default: desc)
- `isFeatured`: Filter featured products (true/false)

**Example Product in Response:**
```json
{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Classic Round Frame",
  "images": ["main1.jpg"],
  "image": "black1.jpg",
  "colors": [
    {
      "name": "Black Classic",
      "display_name": "Black Classic Premium",
      "price": 99.99,
      "value": "black",
      "images": ["black1.jpg"],
      "primaryImage": "black1.jpg",
      "hexCode": "#000000"
    },
    {
      "name": "Gold Premium",
      "display_name": "Gold Premium Edition",
      "price": 129.99,
      "value": "gold",
      "images": ["gold1.jpg"],
      "primaryImage": "gold1.jpg",
      "hexCode": "#FFD700"
    }
  ],
  "selectedColor": "black",
  "currentVariantPrice": 99.99,
  "model_3d_url": "https://s3.../model.glb",
  "price": 25.99
}
```

**Note:** When a customer selects a color variant, use `colors[selectedIndex].display_name` for the product name and `colors[selectedIndex].price` (or `currentVariantPrice`) for the price.
Get all products filtered by category slug. You can combine with other filters like frameShape, frameMaterial, minPrice, maxPrice, etc.
Get all products filtered by subcategory slug. You can combine with other filters like frameShape, frameMaterial, minPrice, maxPrice, etc.

Get all sunglasses products. This endpoint filters products by product_type='sunglasses'. All standard product filters (category, subCategory, frameShape, frameMaterial, minPrice, maxPrice, search, sortBy, sortOrder, isFeatured) can be combined with this endpoint.

**Response format:** Same as "Get All Products" endpoint with products filtered to sunglasses only.

Get all eyeglasses (frames) products. This endpoint filters products by product_type='frame'. All standard product filters (category, subCategory, frameShape, frameMaterial, minPrice, maxPrice, search, sortBy, sortOrder, isFeatured) can be combined with this endpoint.

**Response format:** Same as "Get All Products" endpoint with products filtered to eyeglasses only.

item.name: Get Products by Section - Contact Lenses

request.description:
Get all contact lenses products. This endpoint filters products by product_type='contact_lens'. All standard product filters (category, subCategory, minPrice, maxPrice, search, sortBy, sortOrder, isFeatured) can be combined with this endpoint.

**Response format:** Same as "Get All Products" endpoint with products filtered to contact lenses only.

**Contact Lens Specific Fields:**
- `contact_lens_brand`: Brand/Producer name
- `contact_lens_material`: Material
- `contact_lens_color`: Lens color
- `contact_lens_type`: Product type (Sferica, Toric, etc.)
- `replacement_frequency`: Replacement frequency
- `water_content`: Water content percentage
- `base_curve_options`: Available base curve options
- `diameter_options`: Available diameter options
- `powers_range`: Available power range

item.name: Get Products by Section - Eye Hygiene

request.description:
Get all eye hygiene products. This endpoint filters products by product_type='eye_hygiene'. All standard product filters (category, subCategory, minPrice, maxPrice, search, sortBy, sortOrder, isFeatured) can be combined with this endpoint.

**Response format:** Same as "Get All Products" endpoint with products filtered to eye hygiene only.

**Eye Hygiene Specific Fields:**
- `size_volume`: Size/Volume (e.g., 5ml, 10ml, 30ml)
- `pack_type`: Pack Type (e.g., Single, Pack of 2)
- `expiry_date`: Expiry Date

Get featured products. Each product includes:
- `images`: Array of main product image URLs
- `image`: First image URL of selected color (or main images if no colors)
- `model_3d_url`: URL to 3D model file (null if not available)
- `colors`: Formatted array for color swatches with `name`, `display_name`, `price`, `value`, `images`, `primaryImage`, `hexCode`
- `selectedColor`: Default selected color value
- `color_images`: Raw array of color-specific images
- Standard product fields

**Use `colors` array to display color swatches in product cards.**

Get all form options for product creation/editing including categories, subcategories (with 3-level hierarchy), frame shapes, materials, genders, lens types, lens coatings, frame sizes, etc.

**3-Level Hierarchy Structure:**
- **Category** (e.g., "Contact lenses")
  - **Subcategory** (e.g., "Giornaliere" / Daily) - `parent_id: null`
    - **Sub-subcategory** (e.g., "Sferiche" / Spherical) - `parent_id: [Subcategory.id]`

**Response includes:**
- `categories`: List of all active categories
- `subcategories`: Flat list of all active subcategories with `parent_id` field
- `subcategoriesByCategory`: Subcategories grouped by category_id (keys: category IDs, values: arrays of subcategories)
- `subcategoriesByParent`: Sub-subcategories grouped by parent_id (keys: parent subcategory IDs, values: arrays of sub-subcategories)
- `topLevelSubcategories`: Only top-level subcategories (where `parent_id` is null)
- `frameShapes`: Available frame shapes
- `frameMaterials`: Available frame materials
- `genders`: Available gender options
- `lensTypes`: Available lens types with pricing
- `lensCoatings`: Available lens coatings with pricing
- `lensIndexOptions`: Available lens index options
- `frameSizes`: Available frame sizes
- `lensTypeEnums`: Available lens type enum values: prescription, sunglasses, reading, computer, photochromic, plastic, glass, polycarbonate, trivex, high_index

**Usage Example:**
1. Use `topLevelSubcategories` for the first dropdown (e.g., "Giornaliere", "Settimanale")
2. When a subcategory is selected, use `subcategoriesByParent[subcategoryId]` to get sub-subcategories (e.g., "Sferiche", "Astigmatismo")
3. Products can be assigned to either subcategories or sub-subcategories
4. Use `lensTypeEnums` to populate the lens type dropdown in the product form

Get single product by ID. Returns full product details including:

**Media Fields:**
- `images`: Array of main product image URLs
- `image`: First image URL of selected color (or main images if no colors)
- `model_3d_url`: URL to 3D model file (e.g., .glb, .gltf) - null if not available
- `color_images`: Raw array of color-specific images from database (configured by admin)
- `colors`: **Formatted array for color swatches** - Configured by admin in product's `color_images` field. Each object contains:
  - `name`: Variant name (e.g., "Black Classic", "Gold Premium")
  - `display_name`: Display name shown to customers (e.g., "Black Classic Premium")
  - `price`: Variant-specific price (null if using base product price)
  - `value`: Color value (hex code like "#000000" or color name) - **Use this for matching when adding to cart**
  - `images`: Array of images for this color variant (shown when color is selected)
  - `primaryImage`: First image URL for this color (thumbnail/preview)
  - `hexCode`: Hex color code for swatch display (e.g., "#000000") - **Use this for color swatch background**
- `selectedColor`: Default selected color value (first color's `value` or null)

**Important for Frontend - Color Display:**
- Display color swatches using the `colors` array - each product can have multiple color variants configured by admin
- Use `hexCode` to show the color swatch background
- When user clicks a color swatch, update the product images to show that color's `images` array
- When adding to cart, send the color's `value` field as `selected_color` parameter

**For Contact Lens Products:**
- `base_curve_options`: Available base curve options (array) - e.g., [8.70, 8.80, 8.90]
- `diameter_options`: Available diameter options (array) - e.g., [14.00, 14.20]
- `powers_range`: Available power range (string or object) - e.g., "-0.50 to -6.00 in 0.25 steps"
- `contact_lens_brand`: Brand/Producer name (e.g., "Alcon")
- `contact_lens_material`: Material (e.g., "Nelfilcon A")
- `contact_lens_color`: Lens color
- `contact_lens_type`: Product type (e.g., "Sferica", "Toric")
- `replacement_frequency`: Replacement frequency (e.g., "Giornaliera", "Settimanale", "Mensile")
- `water_content`: Water content percentage
- `can_sleep_with`: Boolean - can sleep with lenses
- `is_medical_device`: Boolean - is medical device
- `has_uv_filter`: Boolean - has UV filter

**For Frame Products:**
- `frameSizes`: Available frame sizes
- `lensTypes`: Available lens types
- `lensCoatings`: Available lens coatings
- Standard product fields (name, price, description, etc.)

**Example Response:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "product": {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "Classic Round Frame",
      "images": ["main1.jpg", "main2.jpg"],
      "image": "black1.jpg",
      "model_3d_url": "https://s3.../model.glb",
      "color_images": [
        {"hexCode": "#000000", "name": "Black Classic", "images": ["black1.jpg", "black2.jpg"]},
        {"hexCode": "#8B4513", "name": "Brown Elegant", "images": ["brown1.jpg"]}
      ],
      "colors": [
        {
          "name": "Black Classic",
          "display_name": "Black Classic Premium",
          "price": 99.99,
          "value": "#000000",
          "images": ["black1.jpg", "black2.jpg"],
          "primaryImage": "black1.jpg",
          "hexCode": "#000000"
        },
        {
          "name": "Brown Elegant",
          "display_name": "Brown Elegant",
          "price": 109.99,
          "value": "#8B4513",
          "images": ["brown1.jpg"],
          "primaryImage": "brown1.jpg",
          "hexCode": "#8B4513"
        }
      ],
      "selectedColor": "#000000",
      "currentVariantPrice": 99.99,
      "price": 99.99
    }
  }
}
```

**Frontend Usage for Color Display:**
1. **Display Color Swatches:** Loop through `colors` array and render color swatches using `hexCode` for background color
2. **Color Selection:** When user clicks a color swatch:
   - Find the color object in `colors` array by matching `value` or `hexCode`
   - Update product display images to show that color's `images` array
   - Update price display to show `price` (if not null) or `currentVariantPrice`
   - Update product name to show `display_name` (optional)
3. **Add to Cart:** When adding to cart, send the selected color's `value` field as `selected_color` parameter
4. **3D Try-On:** Use `model_3d_url` for 3D try-on feature

Get related products from the same category. Each product includes:
- `images`: Array of main product image URLs
- `image`: First image URL of selected color
- `colors`: Formatted array for color swatches with `name`, `display_name`, `price`, `value`, `images`, `primaryImage`, `hexCode`
- `selectedColor`: Default selected color value
- `model_3d_url`: URL to 3D model file (null if not available)
- Standard product fields

**Query Parameters:**
- `limit`: Number of related products to return (default: 4)
Get all lens configuration options for a product including prescription lens types, thickness materials, thickness options, treatments, and colors.
Get all prescription lens types (Distance Vision, Near Vision, Progressive) with their variants and colors.

query.description: Include sample products (up to 5) for each category

request.description:
Get all active categories with optional products and subcategories.

**3-Level Structure:**
- Category (e.g., "Contact lenses")
  - Subcategory (e.g., "Giornaliere") - `parent_id: null`
    - Sub-subcategory (e.g., "Sferiche") - `parent_id: [Subcategory.id]`

**Query Parameters:**
- `includeProducts`: When true, includes up to 5 sample products per category
- `includeSubcategories`: When true, includes subcategories with their sub-subcategories

**Use Cases:**
- Build navigation menus
- Display category listings
- Populate category/subcategory dropdowns

Get a single category by ID with its products and subcategories (with 3-level hierarchy).

**3-Level Hierarchy:**
Returns top-level subcategories (parent_id = null), each including:
- Subcategory details
- `children`: Array of sub-subcategories (if any)

**Response includes:**
- Category details
- Active products in this category
- Top-level subcategories with their sub-subcategories (children)

**Example:**
If category is 'Contact Lenses':
- Returns 'Giornaliere', 'Settimanale', etc. (top-level)
- Each includes children like 'Sferiche', 'Astigmatismo' under 'Giornaliere'

query.description: Maximum number of related categories to return (default: 5)

request.description:
Get categories that have similar subcategories to the given category.

**How it works:**
- Finds all subcategories in the given category (subcategories and sub-subcategories)
- Searches other categories for subcategories with matching or similar names
- Scores categories based on number of matching subcategories
- Returns top results sorted by relevance score

**Response includes:**
- Related categories with matching subcategories
- Relevance score for each category
- List of matching subcategories

Get all active subcategories with pagination support.

**3-Level Structure:**
Category → Subcategory → Sub-subcategory

**Response Structure:**
- `subcategories`: All subcategories with parent/children info
- `topLevelSubcategories`: Subcategories (parent_id = null)
- `nestedSubcategories`: Sub-subcategories (parent_id != null)
- `pagination`: Pagination metadata

**Features:**
- Paginated results
- Filter by category_id
- Search by name
- Includes category, parent, and children information

query.description: Include products associated with this subcategory

request.description:
Get a single subcategory by ID with its category, parent, and children information.

**Response includes:**
- Subcategory details (id, name, slug, description, image, parent_id, etc.)
- `category`: Category information
- `parent`: Parent subcategory (if sub-subcategory, null otherwise)
- `children`: Array of sub-subcategories (if parent subcategory, empty otherwise)
- Products (if includeProducts=true)

Get a single subcategory by slug with its category, parent, and children information.

**Response includes:**
- Subcategory details (id, name, slug, description, image, parent_id, etc.)
- `category`: Category information
- `parent`: Parent subcategory (if sub-subcategory, null otherwise)
- `children`: Array of sub-subcategories (if parent subcategory, empty otherwise)

Get all active subcategories for a specific category with their sub-subcategories.

**Returns:**
- Subcategories (parent_id = null) for the category
- Each subcategory includes its sub-subcategories in `children` array

**Example Structure:**
```
Category: Contact Lenses
  ├─ Subcategory: Giornaliere (parent_id: null)
  │   ├─ Sub-subcategory: Sferiche (parent_id: Giornaliere.id)
  │   └─ Sub-subcategory: Astigmatismo (parent_id: Giornaliere.id)
  └─ Subcategory: Settimanale (parent_id: null)
```

**Use Cases:**
- Populate category/subcategory dropdown menus
- Display navigation
- Filter products by subcategory

Get all sub-subcategories of a specific parent subcategory.

**Purpose:**
Get sub-subcategories for a parent subcategory. Perfect for cascading dropdowns in product forms.

**Example:**
If parent subcategory ID 5 is "Giornaliere", this endpoint returns:
- Sferiche (parent_id: 5)
- Astigmatismo (parent_id: 5)

**Response includes:**
- `parentSubcategory`: Parent subcategory information
- `subcategories`: Array of sub-subcategories

**Use Cases:**
- Product forms: Fetch sub-subcategories when subcategory is selected
- Navigation: Display sub-subcategory menu items
- Filtering: Build product filters

query.description: Sort field: created_at, price, name, rating, updated_at

request.description:
Get all products for a subcategory (including products from sub-subcategories if it's a parent).

**Features:**
- Returns products for the subcategory and its sub-subcategories (if any)
- Paginated results
- Sortable results
- Includes subcategory, parent, children, and category information
- **Color Images Support**: Products include color-specific images with hex codes

**Response includes:**
- `subcategory`: Subcategory details
- `products`: Array of products with formatted images and color variants
- `pagination`: Pagination metadata

**Product Color Images Structure:**
Each product includes:
- `images`: General product images (array)
- `image`: Primary image URL (from selected color or general)
- `color_images`: Raw color images data (array of objects with hexCode, name, price, images)
- `colors`: Formatted color swatches array:
  ```json
  [
    {
      "name": "Black",
      "display_name": "Black",
      "value": "#000000",
      "hexCode": "#000000",
      "price": 99.99,
      "images": ["black1.jpg", "black2.jpg"],
      "primaryImage": "black1.jpg"
    }
  ]
  ```
- `selectedColor`: Default selected color hex code (e.g., "#000000")
- `currentVariantPrice`: Price for selected color variant

**Use Cases:**
- Display products for a subcategory page with color swatches
- Build product listings filtered by subcategory
- Show color-specific images when user selects a color
- Display products from sub-subcategories when viewing parent subcategory

**Frontend Integration:**
- Use `colors` array to display color swatches
- Update product images when user clicks a color swatch
- Use `selectedColor` to track current selection
- Send `selected_color` (hex code) when adding to cart

item.name: Get Contact Lens Options by Sub-SubCategory ID

request.description:
Get aggregated contact lens options (power, base curve, diameter) for Spherical or Astigmatism/Toric sub-subcategories.

**Supported Sub-SubCategory Types:**
- **Spherical**: Sub-subcategories with names containing "spherical", "sferiche", or "sferica"
- **Astigmatism/Toric**: Sub-subcategories with names containing "astigmatism", "astigmatismo", "toric", or "torica"

**Response for Spherical Sub-SubCategories:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "subcategory": { id, name, slug, parent, category },
    "powerOptions": ["-10.00", "-9.75", "-9.50", ...],
    "baseCurveOptions": [8.70, 8.80, 8.90, ...],
    "diameterOptions": [14.00, 14.20, ...],
    "productCount": 15,
    "type": "spherical"
  }
}
```

**Response for Astigmatism/Toric Sub-SubCategories:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "subcategory": { id, name, slug, parent, category },
    "powerOptions": ["-10.00", "-9.75", ...],
    "baseCurveOptions": [8.70, 8.80, ...],
    "diameterOptions": [14.00, 14.20, ...],
    "cylinderOptions": [-0.25, -0.50, -0.75, ..., -6.00],
    "axisOptions": [0, 1, 2, ..., 180],
    "productCount": 15,
    "type": "astigmatism"
  }
}
```

**Features:**
- Automatically detects if sub-subcategory is Spherical or Astigmatism/Toric
- Aggregates all unique options from all products in the sub-subcategory
- Returns sorted arrays ready for dropdown menus
- For Astigmatism: Includes standard cylinder (-0.25 to -6.00) and axis (0-180°) options

**Use Cases:**
- Populate contact lens parameter forms
- Build dropdown menus for power, base curve, diameter, cylinder, and axis
- Validate available options before adding to cart

**Error Cases:**
- Returns 404 if subcategory not found
- Returns 400 if subcategory is not a sub-subcategory (no parent_id)
- Returns 400 if subcategory is not Spherical or Astigmatism/Toric type

item.name: Get Contact Lens Options by Sub-SubCategory Slug

request.description:
Get aggregated contact lens options (power, base curve, diameter) for Spherical or Astigmatism/Toric sub-subcategories by slug.

**Supported Sub-SubCategory Types:**
- **Spherical**: Sub-subcategories with names containing "spherical", "sferiche", or "sferica"
- **Astigmatism/Toric**: Sub-subcategories with names containing "astigmatism", "astigmatismo", "toric", or "torica"

**Response for Spherical Sub-SubCategories:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "subcategory": { id, name, slug, parent, category },
    "powerOptions": ["-10.00", "-9.75", "-9.50", ...],
    "baseCurveOptions": [8.70, 8.80, 8.90, ...],
    "diameterOptions": [14.00, 14.20, ...],
    "productCount": 15,
    "type": "spherical"
  }
}
```

**Response for Astigmatism/Toric Sub-SubCategories:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "subcategory": { id, name, slug, parent, category },
    "powerOptions": ["-10.00", "-9.75", ...],
    "baseCurveOptions": [8.70, 8.80, ...],
    "diameterOptions": [14.00, 14.20, ...],
    "cylinderOptions": [-0.25, -0.50, -0.75, ..., -6.00],
    "axisOptions": [0, 1, 2, ..., 180],
    "productCount": 15,
    "type": "astigmatism"
  }
}
```

**Features:**
- Same as ID endpoint but uses slug instead of ID
- Automatically detects if sub-subcategory is Spherical or Astigmatism/Toric
- Aggregates all unique options from all products in the sub-subcategory
- Returns sorted arrays ready for dropdown menus
- For Astigmatism: Includes standard cylinder (-0.25 to -6.00) and axis (0-180°) options

**Use Cases:**
- Populate contact lens parameter forms using URL-friendly slugs
- Build dropdown menus for power, base curve, diameter, cylinder, and axis
- Validate available options before adding to cart

**Error Cases:**
- Returns 404 if subcategory not found
- Returns 400 if subcategory is not a sub-subcategory (no parent_id)
- Returns 400 if subcategory is not Spherical or Astigmatism/Toric type

Get categories that have subcategories with the same or similar name as the given subcategory.

**How it works:**
1. Gets the specified subcategory
2. Searches all other categories for subcategories with matching names
3. Returns categories grouped by matching subcategories

**Example:**
If subcategory 'Spherical' in 'Contact Lenses' category:
- Finds other categories that also have 'Spherical' subcategory
- May find 'Prescription Glasses' category with 'Spherical' lens type
- Returns matching categories with their matching subcategories

**Response Structure:**
```json
{
  "subcategory": { id, name, slug, category },
  "relatedCategories": [
    {
      "id": 2,
      "name": "Prescription Glasses",
      "matchingSubcategories": [
        { "id": 5, "name": "Spherical" }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
```

**Use Cases:**
- Cross-category navigation
- Related product suggestions
- Category discovery based on subcategory similarity
Get all active coupons. Returns coupons that are currently active and within their valid date range. Use this endpoint to display available coupons in a dropdown or list.

Get available coupons for cart items. Returns coupons that are:
- Active
- Within valid date range
- Applicable to products in cart (if coupon has product/category restrictions)
- Meet minimum order amount requirements

**Request Body:**
- `cartItems` (optional): Array of cart items with `product_id`, `quantity`, `unit_price`
- `productIds` (optional): Array of product IDs
- `subtotal` (optional): Cart subtotal for minimum order validation

**Response:** Returns array of available coupons with discount amounts calculated.

Get form configuration based on sub-sub-category. Returns 'spherical' or 'astigmatism' form structure with fields and dropdown values.

**Note:** Configurations returned by this endpoint include `unit_prices` and `unit_images` fields if set by admin. Use the `GET /api/contact-lens-forms/config/:config_id/unit/:unit` endpoint to get price and images for a selected unit.

Get all active Spherical configurations. Can filter by sub_category_id.

**Response includes:**
- `available_units`: JSON array of available units (independent from qty), e.g., `[10, 20, 30]`
- `unit_prices`: JSON object mapping unit to price, e.g., `{"10": 32.00, "20": 60.00, "30": 90.00}`
- `unit_images`: JSON object mapping unit to image URLs, e.g., `{"10": ["url1"], "20": ["url2"], "30": ["url3"]}`
- All configuration parameters (qty, base_curve, diameter, power, etc.)

**Note:** Units are independent from qty. Qty is used for right/left eye quantity selection, while units represent pack sizes.

item.name: Get Unit Price and Images
item.description:
Get price and images for a selected unit (qty). This endpoint is called when a user selects a unit on the website.

**How it works:**
1. Frontend gets configuration with `unit_prices` and `unit_images`
2. User selects a unit (e.g., "unit 30")
3. Frontend calls this endpoint with `config_id` and `unit` (30)
4. Backend returns the price and images for that specific unit
5. Frontend updates the displayed price and images

**Response includes:**
- `config_id`: Configuration ID
- `config_name`: Configuration name
- `unit`: Selected unit value
- `price`: Price for the selected unit (or base price if unit-specific price not set)
- `images`: Array of image URLs for the selected unit (or product/config images if unit-specific images not set)
- `available_units`: Array of all available units with their prices for reference

**Example Response:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Unit price and images retrieved successfully",
  "data": {
    "config_id": 1,
    "config_name": "Hydra One-daily-Toric",
    "unit": 30,
    "price": 990.00,
    "images": ["http://localhost:5000/uploads/products/unit30-img1.jpg"],
    "available_units": [
      {"unit": 30, "price": 990.00},
      {"unit": 60, "price": 1500.00}
    ]
  }
}
```

**Fallback behavior:**
- If unit-specific price not found, returns base `price` from configuration
- If unit-specific images not found, falls back to product images, then config images

request.description:
Add contact lens to cart with form data. Requires authentication. All values come from admin-managed dropdowns.

**Request Body for Spherical:**
- `product_id` (required): Product ID
- `form_type` (required): "spherical"
- `right_qty`, `right_base_curve`, `right_diameter`, `right_power` (all as strings from dropdowns)
- `left_qty`, `left_base_curve`, `left_diameter`, `left_power` (all as strings from dropdowns)

**Request Body for Astigmatism:**
- `product_id` (required): Product ID
- `form_type` (required): "astigmatism"
- All spherical fields plus:
- `left_cylinder`, `right_cylinder`, `left_axis`, `right_axis` (all as strings from dropdowns)

**Response (Status 200):**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Contact lens added to cart successfully",
  "data": {
    "item": {
      "id": 10,
      "cart_id": 2,
      "product_id": 45,
      "quantity": 2,
      "unit_price": "77.96",
      "contact_lens_right_qty": 1,
      "contact_lens_right_base_curve": 2,
      "contact_lens_right_diameter": 2,
      "contact_lens_right_power": 8,
      "contact_lens_left_qty": 1,
      "contact_lens_left_base_curve": 2,
      "contact_lens_left_diameter": 2,
      "contact_lens_left_power": 7,
      "customization": null,
      "product": {
        "id": 45,
        "name": "spherical",
        "slug": "spherical",
        "price": "77.96",
        "images": []
      }
    }
  }
}
```

**Note:** For astigmatism lenses, `customization` will contain cylinder and axis values as JSON.

Get user's cart with all items. Returns cart items with:

**Image Display Fields (NEW):**
- `display_images`: **Array of images to display** - Shows selected color variant images if color was selected, otherwise shows product's main images
- `display_image`: **First image URL** - Quick access to the primary display image (selected color image or product image)
- `lens_color_image`: **Lens color image URL** - Image of the selected lens color (photochromic or prescription sun color) if a lens color was selected, null otherwise

**For Contact Lens Items:**
- `contact_lens_details`: **Formatted contact lens details object** (null if not a contact lens item):
  - `right_eye`: { `quantity`, `base_curve`, `diameter`, `power` }
  - `left_eye`: { `quantity`, `base_curve`, `diameter`, `power` }
  - `astigmatism`: { `left_cylinder`, `right_cylinder`, `left_axis`, `right_axis` } (only for astigmatism lenses)
- Raw contact lens fields (also available):
  - `contact_lens_right_qty`: Right eye quantity (integer)
  - `contact_lens_right_base_curve`: Right eye base curve (B.C) - e.g., 8.70 (decimal)
  - `contact_lens_right_diameter`: Right eye diameter - e.g., 14.00 (decimal)
  - `contact_lens_right_power`: Right eye power (PWR) - e.g., -1.00, -1.25, +0.50 (decimal)
  - `contact_lens_left_qty`: Left eye quantity (integer)
  - `contact_lens_left_base_curve`: Left eye base curve (B.C) - e.g., 8.70 (decimal)
  - `contact_lens_left_diameter`: Left eye diameter - e.g., 14.00 (decimal)
  - `contact_lens_left_power`: Left eye power (PWR) - e.g., -1.00, -1.25, +0.50 (decimal)

**For Prescription Lens Items:**
- `lens_type`: Lens type (distance_vision, near_vision, progressive)
- `prescription_data`: Prescription data object
- `progressive_variant_id`: Progressive variant ID
- `lens_thickness_material_id`: Thickness material ID
- `lens_thickness_option_id`: Thickness option ID
- `treatment_ids`: Array of treatment IDs
- `photochromic_color_id`: Photochromic color ID
- `prescription_sun_color_id`: Prescription sun color ID

**Color/Variant Selection (for products with color variants):**
- `customization`: Color selection data (if `selected_color` was provided when adding to cart):
  - `selected_color`: Selected color value (hex code or color name)
  - `hex_code`: Hex color code (e.g., "#000000")
  - `color_name`: Color variant name (e.g., "Black Classic")
  - `color_display_name`: Display name shown to customers
  - `variant_price`: Price used for this variant
  - `variant_images`: Array of color-specific images

**Standard Fields:**
- `quantity`: Item quantity
- `unit_price`: Unit price (variant price if color selected, otherwise base price)
- `product`: Product details (includes `images`, `color_images`)
- `subtotal`: Cart subtotal
- `itemCount`: Total number of items

**Example Response for Product with Color Selection:**
```json
{
  "id": 1,
  "product_id": 89,
  "quantity": 1,
  "unit_price": "75.99",
  "display_images": [
    "https://example.com/images/black-1.jpg",
    "https://example.com/images/black-2.jpg"
  ],
  "display_image": "https://example.com/images/black-1.jpg",
  "lens_color_image": null,
  "customization": {
    "selected_color": "#000000",
    "hex_code": "#000000",
    "color_name": "Black Classic",
    "color_display_name": "Black Classic Premium",
    "variant_price": 75.99,
    "variant_images": [
      "https://example.com/images/black-1.jpg",
      "https://example.com/images/black-2.jpg"
    ]
  },
  "product": { ... }
}
```

**Example Response for Product with Lens Color:**

  "display_images": ["https://example.com/images/product-1.jpg"],

request.description:
Add item to cart with full lens configuration including prescription data, thickness options, treatments, and colors.

**Product Information (Required):**
- `product_id`: Product ID to add to cart
- `quantity`: Quantity (default: 1)

**Color/Variant Selection (Optional):**
- `selected_color`: Color value from product's colors array. Can be:
  - Hex code (e.g., "#000000" for black, "#FFD700" for gold) - **Recommended format**
  - Color name (e.g., "black", "brown") - For backward compatibility
  - Must match the `value` field from the product's `colors` array returned by GET /api/products/:id
  - When provided:
    - Uses variant-specific price if available (otherwise uses base product price)
    - Stores color selection (hex code) in cart item's `customization` field
    - Color-specific images are stored for order processing
    - Same color variants are combined (quantity incremented)
    - Different colors create separate cart items

**Lens Configuration (Required for prescription lenses):**
- `lens_type`: Lens type - "distance_vision", "near_vision", or "progressive"
- `prescription_data`: Prescription object with:
  - `pd`: Pupillary Distance (required)
  - `od`: Right Eye object with `sph`, `cyl`, `axis` (required)
  - `os`: Left Eye object with `sph`, `cyl`, `axis` (required)
  - `pd_right`: Right PD (optional, for progressive)
  - `h`: Height (optional, for progressive)
  - `year_of_birth`: Year of birth (optional, for progressive)
- `progressive_variant_id`: Progressive variant ID (required if lens_type is "progressive")
- `lens_thickness_material_id`: Thickness material ID (required)
- `lens_thickness_option_id`: Thickness option ID (required)
- `treatment_ids`: Array of treatment IDs (optional)
- `photochromic_color_id`: Photochromic color ID (optional, if photochromic treatment selected)
- `prescription_sun_color_id`: Prescription sun color ID (optional, if prescription sun selected)

**Contact Lens Fields (Required for contact lens products):**
- `contact_lens_right_qty`: Right eye quantity (integer)
- `contact_lens_right_base_curve`: Right eye base curve (B.C) - e.g., 8.70 (decimal)
- `contact_lens_right_diameter`: Right eye diameter - e.g., 14.00 (decimal)
- `contact_lens_right_power`: Right eye power (PWR) - e.g., -1.00, -1.25, +0.50 (decimal)
- `contact_lens_left_qty`: Left eye quantity (integer)
- `contact_lens_left_base_curve`: Left eye base curve (B.C) - e.g., 8.70 (decimal)
- `contact_lens_left_diameter`: Left eye diameter - e.g., 14.00 (decimal)
- `contact_lens_left_power`: Left eye power (PWR) - e.g., -1.00, -1.25, +0.50 (decimal)

**Legacy Fields (Optional - for backward compatibility):**
- `lens_index`: Lens index value
- `lens_coating`: Single lens coating
- `lens_coatings`: Array of lens coatings
- `prescription_id`: Prescription ID if applicable

**Coupon Code (Optional):**
- `coupon_code`: Coupon code to automatically apply (e.g., "SAVE10")

**Shipping Information (Optional - triggers admin email notification):**
- `first_name`, `last_name`, `email`, `phone`, `address`, `city`, `zip_code`, `country`

**Payment Information (Optional - triggers admin email notification):**
- `card_number`, `cardholder_name`, `expiry_date`, `cvv`

**Response includes:**
- `item`: Cart item with all fields including:
  - `display_images`: **Array of images to display** - Selected color variant images if color was selected, otherwise product's main images
  - `display_image`: **First image URL** - Primary display image (selected color image or product image)
  - `lens_color_image`: **Lens color image URL** - Image of selected lens color (photochromic or prescription sun) if applicable, null otherwise
  - `customization`: Color selection data (if `selected_color` provided) with `selected_color`, `hex_code`, `color_name`, `color_display_name`, `variant_price`, `variant_images`
  - `contact_lens_details`: Formatted contact lens details (formatted object with `right_eye`, `left_eye`, `astigmatism`)
- `coupon`: Applied coupon information (if provided)

**Note:** The system automatically calculates the total price including all add-ons (variant prices, progressive variants, thickness materials, treatments, colors). The `display_images` field ensures the frontend shows the correct product images based on the selected color variant.

Add a simple product to cart with color/variant selection.

**Product Information (Required):**
- `product_id`: Product ID to add to cart
- `quantity`: Quantity (default: 1)

**Color/Variant Selection (Optional):**
- `selected_color`: Color value from product's colors array. Can be:
  - Hex code (e.g., "#000000" for black, "#FFD700" for gold) - **Recommended format**
  - Color name (e.g., "black", "brown") - For backward compatibility
  - Must match the `value` field from the product's `colors` array returned by GET /api/products/:id

**How Color Selection Works:**
1. Get product details: `GET /api/products/:id` returns a `colors` array
2. Each color object has: `value` (hex code), `name`, `display_name`, `price`, `images`, `hexCode`
3. Pass the `value` field (hex code like "#000000" or color name) as `selected_color`
4. Backend will:
   - Find matching color variant by hex code or color name
   - Use variant price if available (otherwise uses base product price)
   - Store color selection (hex code) in cart item's `customization` field
   - Use color-specific images for order processing

**Response includes:**
- `item`: Cart item with:
  - `display_images`: **Array of images to display** - Selected color variant images if color was selected, otherwise product's main images
  - `display_image`: **First image URL** - Primary display image (selected color image or product image)
  - `lens_color_image`: **Lens color image URL** - Image of selected lens color if applicable, null otherwise
  - `customization`: Color selection data with `selected_color`, `hex_code`, `color_name`, `color_display_name`, `variant_price`, `variant_images`
  - `unit_price`: Price used (variant price or base price)

**Example:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Item added to cart",
  "data": {
    "item": {
      "id": 1,
      "product_id": 89,
      "quantity": 1,
      "unit_price": "75.99",
      "display_images": [
        "https://example.com/images/black-1.jpg",
        "https://example.com/images/black-2.jpg"
      ],
      "display_image": "https://example.com/images/black-1.jpg",
      "lens_color_image": null,
      "customization": {
        "selected_color": "#000000",
        "hex_code": "#000000",
        "color_name": "Black Classic",
        "color_display_name": "Black Classic Premium",
        "variant_price": 75.99,
        "variant_images": [
          "https://example.com/images/black-1.jpg",
          "https://example.com/images/black-2.jpg"
        ]
      }
    }
  }
}
```

**Note:**
- If `selected_color` doesn't match any variant, base product price is used (no error)
- Same color variants are combined (quantity incremented)
- Different colors create separate cart items
- The `display_images` field contains the images that should be shown in the cart/UI based on the selected color

Add contact lenses to cart with right and left eye specifications.

**Product Information (Required):**
- `product_id`: Contact lens product ID
- `quantity`: Quantity (default: 1)

**Contact Lens Fields (Required for contact lens products):**
- `contact_lens_right_qty`: Right eye quantity (integer) - e.g., 1, 2, 3
- `contact_lens_right_base_curve`: Right eye base curve (B.C) - e.g., 8.70, 8.80, 8.90 (decimal)
- `contact_lens_right_diameter`: Right eye diameter - e.g., 14.00, 14.20 (decimal)
- `contact_lens_right_power`: Right eye power (PWR) - e.g., -0.50, -0.75, -1.00, -1.25, +0.50, +0.75, +1.00 (decimal)
- `contact_lens_left_qty`: Left eye quantity (integer) - e.g., 1, 2, 3
- `contact_lens_left_base_curve`: Left eye base curve (B.C) - e.g., 8.70, 8.80, 8.90 (decimal)
- `contact_lens_left_diameter`: Left eye diameter - e.g., 14.00, 14.20 (decimal)
- `contact_lens_left_power`: Left eye power (PWR) - e.g., -0.50, -0.75, -1.00, -1.25, +0.50, +0.75, +1.00 (decimal)

**Response includes:**
- `item`: Cart item with `contact_lens_details` (formatted object with `right_eye`, `left_eye`, and `astigmatism` if applicable)
- `coupon`: Applied coupon information (if provided)

**Note:** Available base curve options, diameter options, and power ranges are returned in the product details (GET /api/products/:id). Check the `base_curve_options`, `diameter_options`, and `powers_range` fields in the product response.

Update cart item. You can update quantity and/or contact lens fields.

**Fields (All Optional):**
- `quantity`: New quantity (if 0 or less, item will be removed)

**Contact Lens Fields (Optional - for contact lens products):**
- `contact_lens_right_qty`: Right eye quantity (integer)
- `contact_lens_right_base_curve`: Right eye base curve (B.C) - e.g., 8.70 (decimal)
- `contact_lens_right_diameter`: Right eye diameter - e.g., 14.00 (decimal)
- `contact_lens_right_power`: Right eye power (PWR) - e.g., -1.00, -1.25, +0.50 (decimal)
- `contact_lens_left_qty`: Left eye quantity (integer)
- `contact_lens_left_base_curve`: Left eye base curve (B.C) - e.g., 8.70 (decimal)
- `contact_lens_left_diameter`: Left eye diameter - e.g., 14.00 (decimal)
- `contact_lens_left_power`: Left eye power (PWR) - e.g., -1.00, -1.25, +0.50 (decimal)

**Response includes:**
- `item`: Updated cart item with:
  - `display_images`: **Array of images to display** - Selected color variant images if color was selected, otherwise product's main images
  - `display_image`: **First image URL** - Primary display image (selected color image or product image)
  - `lens_color_image`: **Lens color image URL** - Image of selected lens color if applicable, null otherwise
  - `contact_lens_details`: Formatted contact lens details object with `right_eye`, `left_eye`, and `astigmatism` (if applicable)
  - `customization`: Color selection data (if color was selected when adding to cart)

request.description:
Create a new product with images, 3D model, images with color codes, and size/volume variants.

**Size/Volume Variants (for Eye Hygiene products):**
Use the `sizeVolumeVariants` field to add multiple volume options with individual prices. This is especially useful for Eye Hygiene products that come in different sizes (e.g., 5ml, 10ml, 30ml).

**Format:**
```json
[
  {
    "size_volume": "5ml",
    "pack_type": "Single",
    "price": 8.00,
    "compare_at_price": 10.00,
    "cost_price": 5.00,
    "stock_quantity": 50,
    "stock_status": "in_stock",
    "sku": "SKU-5ML",
    "expiry_date": "2025-12-31",
    "is_active": true,
    "sort_order": 1
  },
  {
    "size_volume": "10ml",
    "pack_type": "Single",
    "price": 14.00,
    "stock_quantity": 75
  }
]
```

**Fields:**
- `size_volume` (required): Volume/size (e.g., "5ml", "10ml", "30ml")
- `price` (required): Price for this variant
- `pack_type` (optional): Pack type (e.g., "Single", "Pack of 2")
- `compare_at_price` (optional): Compare at price
- `cost_price` (optional): Cost price
- `stock_quantity` (optional): Stock quantity (default: 0)
- `stock_status` (optional): in_stock, out_of_stock, backorder (default: in_stock)
- `sku` (optional): SKU for this variant
- `expiry_date` (optional): Expiry date (YYYY-MM-DD format)
- `is_active` (optional): true/false (default: true)
- `sort_order` (optional): Sort order (default: 0)

**Note:** Variants are automatically created when the product is created. You can also manage them separately using the Size/Volume Variants endpoints.

**Response includes:**
- Created product with all fields
- Formatted images and color_images

**Product Information:**
- `name` (required): Product name
- `sku` (required): Unique SKU
- `category_id` (required): Category ID
- `sub_category_id` (optional): Subcategory ID (can be top-level or sub-subcategory)
- `price` (required): Product price
- `description` (optional): Full product description
- `short_description` (optional): Short description (max 500 chars)
- `stock_quantity` (optional): Stock quantity (default: 0)
- `stock_status` (optional): in_stock, out_of_stock, backorder, preorder (default: in_stock)

**Frame Properties:**
- `frame_shape` (optional): round, square, rectangle, oval, cat_eye, aviator, wayfarer, browline, geometric
- `frame_material` (optional): plastic, metal, acetate, titanium, wood, mixed
- `frame_color` (optional): Frame color (e.g., Black, Gold, Brown)
- `gender` (optional): men, women, unisex, kids (default: unisex)

**Lens Type:** Optional field for lens type. Valid values:
- `prescription` - Prescription lenses
- `sunglasses` - Sunglasses
- `reading` - Reading glasses
- `computer` - Computer glasses
- `photochromic` - Photochromic lenses
- `plastic` - Plastic lenses
- `glass` - Glass lenses
- `polycarbonate` - Polycarbonate lenses
- `trivex` - Trivex lenses
- `high_index` - High index lenses

**3D Model:** Upload a 3D model file using the `model_3d` field.

**Images with Color Codes:** Upload multiple images, each associated with a hex color code. Three methods:

1. **Method 1 - Parallel Arrays (Recommended):**
   - Upload multiple images in the `images` field
   - Provide `image_colors` as JSON array: `["#000000", "#FFD700", "#8B4513"]`
   - Each hex code maps to the image at the same index
   - Example: `images[0]`  `image_colors[0]` = `"#000000"`
   - Images without a color code will be added to general product images

2. **Method 2 - Individual Color Fields:**
   - Upload images with field names: `image_#000000`, `image_#FFD700`, etc.
   - Format: `image_#RRGGBB` (e.g., `image_#000000` for black, `image_#8B4513` for brown)
   - Multiple files per color are supported
   - Example: `image_#000000`  Upload 3 files for black color

3. **Method 3 - JSON with URLs:**
   - Send `images_with_colors` as JSON array:
   ```json
   [{
     "hexCode": "#000000",
     "imageUrl": "https://example.com/image1.jpg",
     "name": "Black",
     "price": 99.99
   }]
   ```

**General Images:**
- Upload images in the `images` field without providing `image_colors`
- These will be used as default product images (not color-specific)

**Example:**
- Upload 5 images in `images` field
- Provide `image_colors`: `["#000000", "#000000", "#FFD700", "#FFD700", "#8B4513"]`
- Result: 2 black images, 2 gold images, 1 brown image
- When customer selects a color by hex code, the associated images will be shown

request.description:
Update product details. Supports both JSON and form-data.

**Size/Volume Variants Update:**
Use the `sizeVolumeVariants` field to update variants.  **IMPORTANT:** This field REPLACES all existing variants:
- Variants with `id` in the array will be UPDATED
- Variants without `id` in the array will be CREATED
- Variants NOT in the array will be DELETED

**Example - Update existing and add new:**
```json
[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "size_volume": "5ml",
    "price": 9.00,
    "stock_quantity": 60
  },
  {
    "size_volume": "30ml",
    "pack_type": "Single",
    "price": 20.00,
    "stock_quantity": 40
  }
]
```
**Result:** Variant with id=1 is updated, new 30ml variant is created, all other variants are deleted.

**To skip variant updates:** Simply omit the `sizeVolumeVariants` field - existing variants will remain unchanged.

**Response includes:**
- Updated product with all fields
- Formatted images and color_images

**3-Level Hierarchy Support:**
- You can update `sub_category_id` - it must belong to the product's category
- Products can be assigned to either top-level subcategories or sub-subcategories
- Use `GET /api/subcategories/by-category/:category_id` to get top-level subcategories
- Use `GET /api/subcategories/by-parent/:parent_id` to get sub-subcategories for a parent
- Use `GET /api/products/options` to get all subcategories with hierarchy structure

**Product Information:**
- `name` (optional): Product name
- `price` (optional): Product price
- `description` (optional): Full product description
- `short_description` (optional): Short description (max 500 chars)
- `stock_quantity` (optional): Stock quantity
- `stock_status` (optional): in_stock, out_of_stock, backorder, preorder

**Frame Properties:**
- `frame_shape` (optional): round, square, rectangle, oval, cat_eye, aviator, wayfarer, browline, geometric
- `frame_material` (optional): plastic, metal, acetate, titanium, wood, mixed
- `frame_color` (optional): Frame color (e.g., Black, Gold, Brown)
- `gender` (optional): men, women, unisex, kids

**Lens Type:** Optional field to update lens type. Valid values:
- `prescription` - Prescription lenses
- `sunglasses` - Sunglasses
- `reading` - Reading glasses
- `computer` - Computer glasses
- `photochromic` - Photochromic lenses
- `plastic` - Plastic lenses
- `glass` - Glass lenses
- `polycarbonate` - Polycarbonate lenses
- `trivex` - Trivex lenses
- `high_index` - High index lenses

**3D Model:** Upload a new 3D model file using the `model_3d` field.

** IMAGE UPDATE FLOW (How It Works):**

**Step-by-Step Process:**
1. **Frontend sends request** with `images` field (either as file uploads or JSON array)
2. **Backend receives request** and parses existing product images from database
3. **Backend compares** existing images vs. new images list
4. **Backend deletes** images that exist in old list but NOT in new list (from local storage)
5. **Backend uploads** any new files via multer (saves to local `uploads/` folder)
6. **Backend updates** database with final image list
7. **Backend returns** updated product with new image URLs

** IMAGE MANAGEMENT SCENARIOS:**

**Scenario 1: Clear All Images**
- Send: `images: "[]"` (empty JSON array)
- Flow: Backend deletes ALL existing images from storage, sets database field to `null`
- Result: Product has no images

**Scenario 2: Replace Images**
- Send: `images: "[\"url1\", \"url2\"]"` (list of URLs to keep)
- Flow: Backend keeps only these images, deletes all others from storage
- Result: Product has only the specified images

**Scenario 3: Add New Images (Keep Existing)**
- Send: Upload files via `images` file field (no JSON array)
- Flow: Backend adds new images to existing ones
- Result: Product has both old and new images

**Scenario 4: Replace + Add New Images**
- Send: `images: "[\"url1\"]"` (text field) + upload new files via `images` (file field)
- Flow: Backend keeps specified URLs, adds new uploaded files, deletes rest
- Result: Product has specified URLs + newly uploaded images

**General Images (without color codes):**
- **To REPLACE/DELETE images:** Send `images` as a JSON array string with the complete list of image URLs that should remain.
  - Images NOT in this list will be automatically DELETED from storage (local filesystem) and database
  - Format: `images: "[\"url1\", \"url2\"]"`
  - To delete all images: `images: "[]"`
  - Example: `images: "[\"http://localhost:5000/uploads/products/img1.jpg\", \"http://localhost:5000/uploads/products/img2.jpg\"]"`

- **To ADD new images:** Upload files using the `images` file field. New images will be added to existing ones.
  - If you also send `images` as JSON array, new uploaded files will be added to that list

**Images with Color Codes:** Upload multiple images, each associated with a hex color code. Three methods:

1. **Method 1 - Parallel Arrays (Recommended):**
   - Upload multiple images in the `images` field
   - Provide `image_colors` as JSON array: `["#000000", "#FFD700"]`
   - Each hex code maps to the image at the same index
   - New images will be merged with existing images for each color

2. **Method 2 - Individual Color Fields:**
   - Upload images with field names: `image_#000000`, `image_#FFD700`, etc.
   - Format: `image_#RRGGBB`
   - Multiple files per color are supported
   - New images will be merged with existing images for each color

3. **Method 3 - JSON with URLs:**
   - Send `images_with_colors` as JSON array with image URLs and hex codes
   - Will be merged with existing color images
   - To replace/delete color images, send the complete list of color images that should remain
   - Removed color images will be automatically deleted from storage

** COLOR IMAGES DELETION (IMPORTANT):**

**How Color Images Deletion Works:**
- When `color_images` is sent, it **REPLACES** existing color images (does NOT merge)
- Send the **complete list** of color image objects that should remain
- Color images NOT in this list will be **automatically DELETED** from storage and database
- Individual images within a color can be removed by excluding them from the `images` array

**Color Images Scenarios:**

**Scenario 1: Clear All Color Images**
- Send: `color_images: "[]"` or `color_images: null`
- Flow: Backend deletes ALL existing color images from storage, sets database field to `null`
- Result: Product has no color images 

**Scenario 2: Replace Color Images**
- Send: `color_images: "[{\"hexCode\": \"#000000\", \"name\": \"Black\", \"images\": [\"url1\"]}]"`
- Flow: Backend keeps only this color/image, deletes all other color images from storage
- Result: Product has only the specified color images 

**Scenario 3: Remove Individual Image from Color**
- Previously: `{"hexCode": "#000000", "images": ["url1", "url2", "url3"]}`
- Send: `color_images: "[{\"hexCode\": \"#000000\", \"images\": [\"url1\", \"url2\"]}]"`
- Flow: Backend keeps url1 and url2, deletes url3 from storage
- Result: Color #000000 has only url1 and url2 

**Scenario 4: Remove Entire Color**
- Previously: Colors #000000 and #FFD700
- Send: `color_images: "[{\"hexCode\": \"#000000\", \"images\": [\"url1\"]}]"`
- Flow: Backend keeps #000000, deletes ALL images for #FFD700 from storage
- Result: Only #000000 remains 

**Format for color_images:**
```json
"color_images": "[{\"hexCode\": \"#000000\", \"name\": \"Black\", \"price\": null, \"images\": [\"url1\", \"url2\"]}]"
```

**To clear all color images:**
- `color_images: "[]"`
- `color_images: null`
- `color_images: ""`

** CRITICAL:** When you send `color_images`, it **REPLACES** all existing color images. Images not included will be **DELETED** from storage automatically.

** IMPORTANT NOTES:**
- **Storage:** Files are stored locally using multer (NOT S3) in the `uploads/` directory
- **File URLs:** Returned URLs are local (e.g., `http://localhost:5000/uploads/products/filename.jpg`)
- **Automatic Deletion:** When you clear/replace images, old files are automatically deleted from local storage
- **Database Update:** Image field is set to `null` when all images are cleared
- **No Separate Delete Call:** Image deletion happens automatically during update - no separate API call needed

**Example - Clear All Images:**
```json
{
  "images": "[]"
}
```
Result: All existing images deleted from storage, database field set to `null`

**Example - Replace Images:**
```json
{
  "name": "Updated Product",
  "images": "[\"http://localhost:5000/uploads/products/keep1.jpg\", \"http://localhost:5000/uploads/products/keep2.jpg\"]"
}
```
Result: Only these two images remain, all others deleted from storage

**Example - Add Images (without replacing):**
```json
{
  "sub_category_id": 10,
  "lens_type": "plastic",
  "frame_material": "plastic",
  "frame_shape": "round",
  "gender": "unisex"
}
```
Then upload files via `images` file field - new images added to existing ones

**Example - Clear All Color Images:**
```json
{
  "color_images": "[]"
}
```
Result: All color images deleted from storage, database field set to `null`

**Example - Replace Color Images (Keep Only Black):**
```json
{
  "color_images": "[{\"hexCode\": \"#000000\", \"name\": \"Black\", \"images\": [\"http://localhost:5000/uploads/products/colors/000000/black1.jpg\"]}]"
}
```
Result: Only Black color images remain, all other colors deleted from storage

**Example - Remove Individual Image from Color:**
Previously had: `{"hexCode": "#000000", "images": ["url1", "url2", "url3"]}`
```json
{
  "color_images": "[{\"hexCode\": \"#000000\", \"name\": \"Black\", \"images\": [\"url1\", \"url2\"]}]"
}
```
Result: url3 deleted from storage, only url1 and url2 remain

**File Upload Example:**
- Use field name: `image_#000000` to upload images for black color
- Use field name: `image_#FFD700` to upload images for gold color
- Multiple files per hex color are supported

** REMEMBER:**
- `images` field: Controls general images (without color codes)
- `color_images` field: Controls images with color codes
- Both fields work independently
- Deleted images are removed from storage AND database
- Deleted images will NOT appear in the product table after update

Bulk update size/volume variants for a product. This endpoint allows you to update multiple variants at once.

**How it works:**
- Variants with `id` will be updated
- Variants without `id` will be created as new variants
- Variants not included in the array will be deleted

**Example:**
- Existing variants: [id=1 (5ml), id=2 (10ml)]
- Send: [{id: 1, price: 9.00}, {size_volume: "30ml", price: 20.00}]
- Result: id=1 updated, id=2 deleted, new 30ml variant created

**Response:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Size/volume variants updated successfully",
  "data": {
    "product_id": 1,
    "variants": [
      {
        "id": 1,
        "product_id": 1,
        "size_volume": "5ml",
        "pack_type": "Single",
        "price": 9.00,
        "stock_quantity": 60,
        "is_active": true,
        "sort_order": 1
      },
      {
        "id": 3,
        "product_id": 1,
        "size_volume": "30ml",
        "pack_type": "Single",
        "price": 20.00,
        "stock_quantity": 40,
        "is_active": true,
        "sort_order": 3
      }
    ]
  }
}
```

Get all orders with pagination. Admin only.

**Query Parameters:**
- `page`: Page number (default: 1)
- `limit`: Items per page (default: 20)
- `status`: Filter by order status (optional)
- `payment_status`: Filter by payment status (optional)

**Response includes for each order:**
- Order details (status, payment_status, totals, etc.)
- User information
- `items`: Array of order items, each with:
  - `contact_lens_details`: **Formatted contact lens details** (null if not a contact lens item):
    - `right_eye`: { `quantity`, `base_curve`, `diameter`, `power` }
    - `left_eye`: { `quantity`, `base_curve`, `diameter`, `power` }
    - `astigmatism`: { `left_cylinder`, `right_cylinder`, `left_axis`, `right_axis` } (only for astigmatism lenses)
  - Raw contact lens fields (also available)
  - Product details
  - **All cart item data preserved in order items:**
    - `prescription_id`: Prescription ID (if applicable)
    - `lens_type`: Lens type (e.g., "progressive", "single_vision")
    - `prescription_data`: JSON object with prescription details (PD, sphere, cylinder, axis, etc.)
    - `progressive_variant_id`: Progressive variant ID (with related `progressiveVariant` object)
    - `lens_thickness_material_id`: Lens thickness material ID (with related `lensThicknessMaterial` object)
    - `lens_thickness_option_id`: Lens thickness option ID (with related `lensThicknessOption` object)
    - `treatment_ids`: JSON array of treatment IDs
    - `photochromic_color_id`: Photochromic color ID (with related `photochromicColor` object)
    - `prescription_sun_color_id`: Prescription sun color ID (with related `prescriptionSunColor` object)
    - `unit_price`: Price from cart item
  - All other item fields

**All customer selections from cart items are now preserved in order details for admin review.**

Get detailed information about a specific order. Admin only.

**Response includes:**
- Complete order details (status, payment_status, shipping_address, billing_address, etc.)
- User information (name, email, phone)
- `items`: Array of order items with full details:
  - `contact_lens_details`: **Formatted contact lens details** (null if not a contact lens item):
    - `right_eye`: { `quantity`, `base_curve`, `diameter`, `power` }
    - `left_eye`: { `quantity`, `base_curve`, `diameter`, `power` }
    - `astigmatism`: { `left_cylinder`, `right_cylinder`, `left_axis`, `right_axis` } (only for astigmatism lenses)

  - **All cart item data preserved in order items:**
    - `prescription_id`: Prescription ID (if applicable, with related `prescription` object)

**Response includes:**

- `parentSubcategories`: Array of subcategories that can be parents, each with:

  - `name`: Subcategory name
  - `slug`: Subcategory slug

  - `image`: Subcategory image URL

Get sub-subcategories (children) of a specific parent subcategory. Useful for admin cascading dropdowns.

**3-Level Hierarchy:**
This endpoint retrieves the third level - sub-subcategories that belong to a parent subcategory.

**Response includes:**
- `parentSubcategory`: Information about the parent subcategory
- `subcategories`: Array of sub-subcategories with:
  - `parent_id`: The parent subcategory ID (matches the parent_id in URL)
  - `category`: Category information

**Example:**
If parent subcategory ID 5 is 'Giornaliere', returns all sub-subcategories where `parent_id = 5`:
- Sferiche (parent_id: 5)
- Astigmatismo (parent_id: 5)

**Use Cases:**
- Admin cascading dropdowns: Show sub-subcategories when parent is selected
- Building hierarchical navigation in admin panel
- Filtering products by sub-subcategory levels

request.description:
Create a new sub-subcategory.

**Required Fields:**
- `name`: Sub-subcategory name
- `category_id`: ID of the category
- `parent_id`: ID of the parent subcategory (must be a subcategory in the same category)

**Optional Fields:**
- `slug`: URL-friendly slug (auto-generated from name if not provided)
- `description`: Sub-subcategory description
- `is_active`: Active status (default: true)
- `sort_order`: Display order (default: 0)
- `image`: Image file (use multipart/form-data for file uploads)

**Example Request:**
```json
{
  "name": "Sferiche",
  "slug": "sferiche",
  "category_id": 1,
  "parent_id": 5,
  "description": "Spherical contact lenses",
  "is_active": true
}
```
Where `parent_id: 5` is the ID of the parent subcategory.

**How to Get Parent ID:**
1. Call `GET /api/admin/subcategories/available-parents/:category_id`
2. This returns list of subcategories that can be parents
3. Use one of those IDs in `parent_id` field

**Validation:**
- Category must exist and be active
- Parent subcategory must exist, be active, and belong to the same category

**Response:**
Returns the created sub-subcategory with category and parent information

  "category_id": 1,
  "parent_id": null,
  "description": "Subcategory for men's frames",
  "sort_order": 1,
  "is_active": true
}

- `slug`: URL-friendly slug (auto-generated from name if not provided)
- `description`: Subcategory description
- `is_active`: Active status (default: true)
- `sort_order`: Display order (default: 0)
- `image`: Image file (use multipart/form-data for file uploads)

**Example Request:**
```json
{
  "name": "Men Frames",
  "slug": "men-frames",
  "category_id": 1,
  "parent_id": null,
  "description": "Subcategory for men's frames",

```

The response includes the created subcategory with:

**Validation:**

Update subcategory details. Supports converting between subcategory and sub-subcategory.

**Updatable Fields:**
- `name`: Subcategory name
- `slug`: URL-friendly slug (sanitized automatically if provided)
- `category_id`: Change the category (must be valid)
- `parent_id` or `parent_subcategory_id`: Set parent subcategory. Set to `null` to make it a subcategory.
- `description`: Subcategory description
- `is_active`: Active status
- `sort_order`: Display order
- `image`: Image file (use multipart/form-data)

**Converting Types:**
- To make a sub-subcategory: Set `parent_id` to the parent subcategory ID
- To make it a subcategory: Set `parent_id` to `null`
- Parent subcategory must belong to the same category
- Cannot set a subcategory as its own parent
- Prevents circular references automatically

**Example - Make sub-subcategory:**
```json
{
  "parent_id": 5,
  "slug": "updated-slug"
}
```

**Example - Make subcategory:**
```json
{
  "parent_id": null
}
```

**Response:**
The response includes the updated subcategory with:
- `parent_id`: The parent subcategory ID (null for subcategories)
- `parent`: Parent subcategory object (if sub-subcategory)
- `children`: Array of sub-subcategories (if any)
- `category`: Category information

**Note:** Use multipart/form-data when uploading an image file.

Delete a subcategory.

**Behavior:**
- **Products Check**: Cannot delete if subcategory has associated products. Returns error with product count.
- **Children Handling**: If subcategory has sub-subcategories, they will automatically become subcategories (parent_id set to null) due to database schema's `onDelete: SetNull`.
- **Image Cleanup**: Automatically deletes associated image from S3 storage.

**Response includes:**
- `deleted`: Object with deletion details:
  - `id`: Deleted subcategory ID
  - `name`: Deleted subcategory name
  - `slug`: Deleted subcategory slug
  - `wasNested`: Boolean indicating if it was a sub-subcategory
  - `childrenCount`: Number of sub-subcategories that became subcategories

**Example Response:**
```json
{
  "deleted": {
    "id": 10,
    "name": "Spherical",
    "slug": "spherical",
    "wasNested": true,
    "childrenCount": 0
  }
}
```

**Error Cases:**
- Returns 400 error if subcategory has associated products
- Returns 404 error if subcategory not found

**Note:** This operation cannot be undone. Make sure to reassign or delete products before deleting a subcategory.

Get all Spherical configurations with pagination. Admin only.

Create a new Spherical configuration. Arrays allow multiple values for each parameter.

**New Feature - Product Assignment**:
- Add `"product_id": 1` to assign a contact lens product to this configuration.
- The product must be of type 'contact_lens' and belong to the same category as the configuration.
- Use the GET /api/contact-lens-forms/admin/products endpoint to get available contact lens products.

**New Feature - Copy Right to Left**:
- Add `"copy_right_to_left": true` or `"same_for_both_eyes": true` to automatically copy all right eye values to left eye fields.
- When using this feature, you can omit left eye parameters (left_qty, left_base_curve, left_diameter, left_power) as they will be automatically set from right eye values.

** NEW FEATURE - Unit-Based Pricing and Images (Independent from Qty)**:
- **`available_units`** (optional): JSON array of available units (independent from qty). Format: `[10, 20, 30]`
  - Units are separate from qty - they represent pack sizes (e.g., unit 10 = 10 lenses, unit 20 = 20 lenses)
  - Example: `"available_units": [10, 20, 30]`

- **`unit_prices`** (optional): JSON object mapping unit to price. Format: `{"10": 32.00, "20": 60.00, "30": 90.00}`
  - Keys are unit values as strings, values are prices as numbers
  - When a unit is selected on the website, the price adjusts automatically
  - Example: `"unit_prices": {"10": 32.00, "20": 60.00, "30": 90.00}`

- **`unit_images`** (optional): JSON object mapping unit to image URLs. Format: `{"10": ["url1"], "20": ["url2"], "30": ["url3"]}`
  - Keys are unit values as strings, values are arrays of image URLs
  - When a unit is selected on the website, the images change automatically
  - Example: `"unit_images": {"10": ["http://localhost:5000/uploads/products/unit10-img1.jpg"], "20": ["http://localhost:5000/uploads/products/unit20-img1.jpg"]}`

**How Unit-Based Pricing Works:**
1. Admin sets `available_units`, `unit_prices`, and `unit_images` when creating/updating configuration
2. Website displays available units (e.g., "unit 10", "unit 20", "unit 30") from `available_units` array
3. When user selects a unit, frontend calls `GET /api/contact-lens-forms/config/:config_id/unit/:unit`
4. Backend returns the price and images for that specific unit
5. Website displays the adjusted price and corresponding images

**Note:** Units are completely independent from qty (quantity). Qty is still used for right/left eye quantity selection in the form.

**Example with all features**:
```json
{
  "name": "Hydra One-daily-Toric",
  "sub_category_id": 1,
  "product_id": 1,
  "right_qty": [30, 60],
  "right_base_curve": [8.6, 8.7, 8.8],
  "right_diameter": [14.0, 14.2, 14.5],
  "right_power": [-2.00, -2.25, -2.50],
  "copy_right_to_left": true,
  "price": 990.00,
  "display_name": "Hydra One-daily-Toric",
  "unit_prices": {
    "30": 990.00,
    "60": 1500.00
  },
  "unit_images": {
    "30": ["http://localhost:5000/uploads/products/unit30-img1.jpg"],
    "60": ["http://localhost:5000/uploads/products/unit60-img1.jpg"]
  }
}
```

item.name: Submit Prescription Form with Copy Left to Right

request.description:
Submit prescription form data. **New Feature - Copy Left to Right**:
- Add `"copy_left_to_right": true` or `"same_for_both_eyes": true` to automatically copy all left eye values (SPH, CYL, AXIS) to right eye fields.
- When using this feature, you can omit right eye parameters (right_eye_sph, right_eye_cyl, right_eye_axis) as they will be automatically set from left eye values.

**Example with copy_left_to_right**:
```json
{
  "form_type": "progressive",
  "pd": "64",
  "pd_right": "32",
  "h": "18",
  "left_eye_sph": "-2.00",
  "left_eye_cyl": "-0.50",
  "left_eye_axis": "90",
  "copy_left_to_right": true,
  "select_option": "premium",
  "year_of_birth": "1980"
}
```
